abstract: Amazon removed Macmillan books from its site in a dispute over prices of e-books.
snippet: Amazon removed Macmillan books from its site in a dispute over prices of e-books.
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:01 p.m. Amazon relents and is selling Macmillan books again.

headline.main: Amazon Pulls Macmillan Books Over E-Book Price Disagreement

abstract: Bits: Amazon has pulled Macmillan titles from its site in a disagreement over e-book pricing.
snippet: Bits: Amazon has pulled Macmillan titles from its site in a disagreement over e-book pricing.
lead_paragraph: Amazon has pulled books published by Macmillan from its site in a disagreement between the online retailer and the publisher over the price of e-books. For the moment, Macmillan books are available on Amazon only when bought through third parties. Macmillan, like other publishers, has been wrangling with Amazon over the retailer’s insistence that all e-books for its Kindle device be priced at $9.99. Many publishers want to charge more, or at least have more control over prices for individual books. The dispute hit a new level this week when Apple introduced its new iPad device, which will have an iBooks application through which publishers will have more control over e-book prices. The full story is here.

headline.main: Bits: Amazon Pulls Macmillan Books from Its Site

abstract: The move is one result of the strong disagreement between the Internet company and the publisher over the pricing of e-books.
snippet: The move is one result of the strong disagreement between the Internet company and the publisher over the pricing of e-books.
lead_paragraph: Amazon.com has pulled books from Macmillan, one of the largest publishers in the United States, in a dispute over the pricing on e-books on the site.

byline.original: By Brad Stone and Motoko Rich
